question: Which of the following relates to the notice of protest under section 102 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881?
option1: may be given by the notary public who makes the protest
option2: must always be given by the notary public who makes the protest
option3: must be given by the holder
answer: may be given by the notary public who makes the protest
explanation: When a promissory note or bill of exchange is required by law to be protested, notice of such protest must be given instead of notice of dishonour, in the same manner and subject to the same conditions; but the notice may be given by the notary public who makes the protest.
